Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Bes. Bes standing on the capital block of a column, naked, with his hands on his thighs; he wears a feathered headdress (broken). The column capital widens upwards and is undecorated, probably based on a papyrus capital. Hollow, from a two-piece mould. Red-brown Nile silt fabric.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallels from Naukratis (Bristish Museum GR1886,0401.1455, 1888,0601.105 ; Boston MFA 86.444;Walters 1903, C 594; Higgins 1954, no. 1546), possibly same mould series (Cambridge NA685). The fabric is consistent with Nile Delta kiln products, probably from Naukratis. Similar Bes figures have been found in Ptolemaic contexts, or dated to the Roman period (Bailey 2008, 38; Fischer 1994, 257, Cat. 551; Dunand 1990, 42-3, Cat. 42-45; Frankfurter 1998: pl. 11 from the Fayum). Dunand, F. 1990. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Catalogue des terres cuites grécoromaines d'Egypte. Paris. Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen: Wasmuth. Frankfurter, D. 1998. ‘Religion in Roman Egypt, Assimilation and Resistance.’ Princeton.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.204) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4596 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
